0 Param data.1 string m_text: I admire your confident spirit. You never seem lost.
Observing your journey is the greatest pleasure I have now.
Why do people get so lost? It only ever seems to bring them pain.
The time you and I get to spend together is all that's left to a Daemon like me.
You have liberated my soul from its bonds, and for that I swear my loyalty to you.
Our souls are drawn together. Such is the bond between a human and a Daemon.
I sense the trembling of a young Lost Soul...
Another soul has ties to this Lost boy. I believe it is nearby.
Even people who share a common purpose may have differing opinions. Is it not the same for the Watchers?
The world is awash in sound and emotion. Surely this is the Living World... Yes, I once inhabited this place.
How dreadful that the soul forgets, no matter how much one longs for connection after death.
The connections we crave will persist if we maintain our faith. What a noble sentiment.
I don't know you, and I won't hesitate to kill you if I don't like you.
I thank you for giving me a reason to exist. I am in your debt.
Is it just my imagination, or was there a little girl leading you around?
Who was that girl? There was something quite strange about her.
Linne is a curious being. She's not quite like the rest of us.
There's meaning in every meeting, and that's reason enough to nurture them.
Do you believe maintaining a connection with those you love is truly a good thing?
Life is fleeting, even if souls can turn into Daemons.
Humans do their best to live with and support one another. You're such beautiful creatures.
So the one known as Hitoha has cast aside her duty as a Watcher. How unfortunate.
Connections enrich our lives, sure, but they can be a source of anguish, too.
Part of me was rather envious of Hitoha. Isn't that ridiculous?
The souls of you Watchers may be tested more than most.
I'd like to believe that those two will meet again in the next life.
There is no greater crime than taking the life of someone who wishes to live.
I can't help but feel that reincarnation and the nature of life are connected.
You feel it too, don't you? The faintest traces of hate. I can't stand it.
How could anyone who would take the life of another smile like that?
When a person is reincarnated, the soul persists. But it will now have a different life, and a different future.
I can't believe someone meant to shepherd life between realms would commit such an atrocity. It's despicable.
A leader who becomes so entangled in their own logic they lose sight of life's value is no leader at all.
Human malice spreads through this kingdom like a disease, choking it from within.
We must do everything in our power to ease the suffering of these women.
Something tells me Juta is dangerous. I would be careful around him.
Profound sadness, mixed with grief and love... What is all this? Is someone else interfering?
Somewhere out there, I feel the presence of two souls tightly bound together.
Death is a void that no amount of love can fill.
Juta's love is conceited, but I suppose that proves he is human.
Longing for a loved one can be its own form of agony.
When you're with someone, it's easy to assume your bond will be eternal, but all things must end.
Mayura longed to be a part of you, both as a Watcher and as someone dear to you.
People cannot help but hate. That isn't going to change.
How could you hate another, or take a life? It's all so senseless.
People born of the same blood do not always share the same dreams. Such is life.
This family is wrapped in love's warm embrace.
This place feels safe and comforting. I wonder why?
Can love and trust truly conquer sorrow?
You can watch over someone without becoming one of the Lost? I didn't know that was possible.
What a lovely mother. She is the heart and soul of her family.
I wish to know the true nature of my soul. I pray you can help me find it.
Fulfilling desires is great and all, but it isn't the same as progress...
So many people are prisoners of their own sadness. Humans cannot survive without nurturing love.
I sense the presence of a man named Bossa. His is a powerful soul.
This doesn't make sense. How could someone who turned into one of the Fallen reclaim their human spirit?
I can't believe Bossa was still consumed with thoughts about someone else, despite being one of the Fallen.
I get the feeling that the kingdom cannot move on unless the Night Devil is dealt with.
I suppose it was inevitable that humanity would forever seek meaning in life and reincarnation.
Connections between people are connections between souls, and they greatly enrich the next life.
That aura around the Night Devil... Why does it feel so familiar?
The ebb and flow of reincarnation has been disrupted. Something strange is going on around the dungeon.
You're going to meet Zale, aren't you? He's got a twisted soul. I can tell just from the smell of him.
The darkness within the Night Devil is boundless, his hatred fierce. He cannot be left unchecked.
Why can't people detach themselves from their emotions? It's not as though they serve a purpose.
People cannot fight their own emotions, especially where a loved one is concerned.
Your purpose is to serve. You cannot afford to lose sight of that now.
I think I understand it now. The pain Kushi's feeling will never go away.
So what's it going to be? What will you protect?
I've been thinking for a long time about what I'm fighting against, and it seems the time to reconsider that has come once again.
At last, my soul is free. It has been such a long time coming.
The Watchers have long been mediators, but their hands may be less than clean.
Just say the word, and I'll do everything I can to protect this kingdom.
Kushi brought this chaos upon us, and it has spread through the kingdom just as he expected.
What is this Lobelia person so afraid of?
That woman is beyond redemption. Wouldn't the kingdom be better off without her?
You're haunted by memories you supposedly lost? Strange. You shouldn't be able to remember them at all.
Why do such tragic things happen? Why must people suffer like this?
Humans cannot thrive if they are coddled. But they cannot endure constant sorrow, either.
That thing is inside the kingdom. I felt its presence even as I slept.
That woman is quite attached to her own life. This is going to be delightful.
I sense a darkness roiling beneath the palace. What could it be?
This presence... Does danger draw near?
The spirits of the people drift apart. A multitude of souls quiver in fear.
We have talked all we can. The time has come to stand together as one, no matter how grim the circumstances.
People will never completely understand one another, so why don't we stop wasting our time trying?
You have to live. I know it won't be easy for you, but it's the only way.
You needn't feel lost. You have only yourself to answer to.
Despair seizes the people, sealing off their hearts. Only you can show them the way forward.
There are so many wounded, suffering souls...
Don't lose sight of the true enemy.
Perhaps it was always my destiny to become a Daemon and meet you.
What more can that foul woman do, now that her true colors have been revealed?
Your message will reach the people. Don't give up hope!
Something dark has begun to fall across the kingdom. Something filled with despair...
I believe your fate is inextricably linked to that of the Night Devil.
We must protect the souls bound for the next life, and the kingdom that will nurture them once they're reborn!
The malevolence haunting the kingdom feeds the Night Devil. Its power grows.
This despair has such hunger that even the souls of the Daemons may not be enough to sate it.
The source of the Night Devil's hatred is a most curious subject.
There is a boy, Ikoko, whose soul must be put to rest.
It seems the Scourge has consumed this realm as well.
I wonder what kind of man that Ikoko wanted to grow up to be.
How heartbreaking to think of someone forgetting everything about their past life and just wandering forever.
The truth is I just can't get behind this whole reincarnation thing. Maybe to doubt is to be human.
Oh, so I'm useful now that I've turned into a Daemon? Hilarious. Well then, your wish is my command.
I feel anguish, but it isn't my own... Or is it? Could this aching be the memories of my past life?
It's hard to think that something as steeped in hatred and malice as the Night Devil was once human.
Rejecting death, resisting reincarnation... Humans never cease to amuse me.
Things won't change as long as people are people. That's why I'M going to change.
A chill darkness is settling over this realm. It is a portent of things to come—but what?
It was like Mayura could sense it, that destiny within you.
Something tells me that you and the Night Devil are pulling on two ends of the same thread of fate.
Resenting the past changes nothing. When you stop moving forward, your soul dies.
The Night Devil's mind used to be so clouded, but now it grows clear. Why is that?
Sins are what we define them to be. What sins do you carry?
I long to meet this so-called Soju so badly, I feel my soul may rend itself to shreds.
The question is, WHY did Soju's emotions tear him in two? Somehow, I feel like I know the answer.
The Night Devil is a soul that strayed from the path of reincarnation, even as it yearned to be reborn.
Incredible to think you and the Night Devil share the same soul. It seems your fates were intertwined after all.
So you and the Night Devil are going to become one again? Or perhaps one of you will disappear. This ought to be interesting.
Kagachi? You ARE Kagachi, aren't you? Tell me what's going on!
What's happening? I didn't know Watchers could do this!
You are quite a character, Kagachi. I don't think I'll ever be bored again as long as I'm with you.
The ache of my memories has gotten worse. Could this feeling mean... No, it couldn't possibly...
Something beckoned us to this place the moment you finished things with the Night Devil.
The fact that we're aware of what's happening means that this can't be a dream.
I've never experienced anything so strange before. Maybe we ought to take it as a sign that the world has changed.
So your soul's been restored to a body in the past? Perhaps this is a consequence of what happened in the future.
Are you suggesting that time has somehow warped? This is absolutely baffling! How marvelous!
The very fact that we are still with you is proof that you are still Kagachi.
I'm inclined to believe there is a meaning to life, given the state of things.
Are you saying something happened to you when you ended things with the Night Devil?
Do you think someone was hoping something like this would happen?
The girl, Linne—there's no sign of her. Where in the world could she be?
It seems Soju's timeline picked up where it left off when you absorbed the Night Devil.
So time has no effect on souls. I still have so much to learn, even as a Daemon.
Your soul traveled back in time to this body. It sounds too fantastic to be true, but it is.
No matter how much you change on the outside, your soul is still the same. My duty is unchanged.
The reality is that you, Kagachi, have become Soju. Best to just accept it and carry on.
The young ones are the hope of the future, the treasure that connects us all together.
Perhaps there's a reason you've returned to the past like this.
If this is the past, then your souls are linked. Though you're the only one who can know that for certain.
So if we're in the past, does that mean we can change the future? Think of the possibilities.
I wonder if it was Linne's job to guide you to this time?
This is before your soul was split in two. Maybe this is all meant as a test.
Seeing that little girl reminds me of the time Mayura and I were together.
Unconditional love helps people in so many ways. I feel so...happy.
You really don't remember anything about your past life? Probably for the best, otherwise you might become one of the Fallen.
Everyone is born innocent and pure, but no one can stay that way. That's part of being human.
All I want is for life to flourish. We must protect it.
Even if you are living another life, you're still YOU underneath it all. Just be Kagachi.
Could be the Night Devil's only wish was to break Soju's curse so you could live as one.
The Night Devil dwells within Soju, too. Be careful.
The life that Soju lived, his memories—everything he knew is yours to draw upon now. It might help you.
Whatever horrible fate awaits you, it's your duty to accept it and meet it head-on.
So this is how the Night Devil came to be. How awful...
In spite of all that, Soju still lived. I wonder why? I cannot fathom other people's motivations.
His past is full of such pain. Such strife. The grief is overwhelming.
This kingdom is a terrible place. No wonder the Night Devil was born.
Sooner or later Soju was bound to hate the life he was born into, but still... He was so young when he lost all he loved.
The children were innocent, and still the adults condemned them to such a cruel fate.
It seems connection with someone was all he needed to resurface. Even hatred was enough to sustain him.
I wonder if traces of anger linger within me, too.
The Night Devil could have been born when Soju was still just a kid.
I wonder what Soju was thinking, when he gazed into the abyss.
So that boy who refused to accept death was Ikoko. Seems your fates were more deeply intertwined than we knew.
Maybe what's happened is the reverse of reincarnation. Figuring this out could change everything.
Ikoko and Soju might be more alike than we know. Perhaps their meeting was more than a chance encounter.
People are ruined when they lose everything they love. This kingdom is truly a tragic place.
Turns out our journey down Soju's memory lane was also a journey into the very heart of the Night Devil himself.
This agony coursing through my being... Have I felt this before?
Soju made up his mind. He was ready to let malice consume him.
So this is a journey to connect with Soju. To learn what business he left unfinished.
Time rolling back on itself was no coincidence. Change is on the wind—can you feel it?
Maybe it was your destiny to live Soju's life like this.
Soju's past seems immutable, yet...if there IS anything we can do, I want to try.
Perhaps Soju was trying to protect his own soul by protecting those of the dead.
The thing that stirred Soju—the Night Devil—to action wasn't just hatred, but his sorrow for others.
Love alone won't change a person. I feel like the potential for the Night Devil was always there.
Life is contradiction. But somehow people find a way to live in spite of it all.
Resenting your fate changes nothing, but blindly raging against it is no better.
Soju acted to free the people from the curse of reincarnation. He's similar to Kushi in that sense.
The souls are in turmoil. This kingdom's devastation was all but inevitable.
People who only know how to communicate through battle. Change that only comes through strife. It's a recipe for disaster.
Soju's soul has been crying out, lost in the darkness this whole time.
This feeling within me... It's like I know something, but what?
Life is fragile. The more you care for someone else, the clearer that becomes.
Why throw away a life you wish to keep? Understanding can be achieved, if you but try.
Man's weakness is the root of the Scourge. If only man would fight against that fate.
Is it hope of rebirth that weakens man's will? Or is it the inherent despair of mortality?
Though I've learned the truth, I still cannot reclaim my memories. Curse this Daemon form.
Perhaps Soju was searching for his own feelings within the hearts of others.
So in the end, I guess Soju's actions were just a manifestation of the strife throughout the realm.
So, Soju's prayers led him out of the darkness, and into the future where he found Kagachi.
The light that Soju found while he wandered in darkness was you, Kagachi.
Brother and sister... Those words resonate in my heart. Could this be old memories stirring?
Sometimes, I imagine I can feel a warm hand in mine. Maybe once, long ago, I was happy?
It doesn't matter if I have my memories or not; I think we were destined to meet.
It's finally time. Soju can move on now.
Think the Night Devil was expecting something when he merged with you? That something might change?
To seek you out beyond death, without becoming lost or reincarnating... How is this possible?
A bond that transcends even reincarnation. I think that's what Mayura wished for herself, too.
So Linne was Sara's prayers made flesh. Her bond weathered the very tides of time. A remarkable feat.
Sovereign Sara... Will she be the one to overturn reincarnation itself?
The ones we protect give us strength. Do not forget that, Kagachi.
Could you feel it in Linne, Kagachi? The links that chain your souls together?
A power beyond human ken resides within the sovereign. It resembles that of the shadowless within me.
Linne is a manifestation of Sara's hopes; a miracle born of a bond. I never imagined such a thing was possible.
Projecting your consciousness into the future seems like an inhuman feat.
Even if only your consciousness is linked, it may be enough to change who you are.
I wonder if I was fighting somewhere in the battle depicted on that wall.
Learning about the realm's origins may serve some deeper purpose for you.
I don't know what that mural is trying to convey, but looking at it makes me ponder the violence of life. It's art, pure and simple.
I guess there was some battle that was important in the founding of the kingdom?
I sense something...inhuman. Kagachi, be on your guard.
I see that the world fought the vile Scourge even long after I died.
See that person in the center of the mural, leading humanity? Who do you think that is?
Despite all the life that's been lost, people still cling to the tenets of reincarnation.
Does this mean that the people who originally lived in this land weren't human?
An ancient battle... I wonder how it changed the world?
This sense of creeping dread... What can it be? The wail of a fading soul?
Incredible that a single door sealed away such monstrous power.
That lady always rubs me the wrong way. Her soul feels rotten to the core.
This land never fails to entertain me. I can't wait to see what further surprises it has in store.
Is this fear I feel towards whatever lies beyond that door? Me, a Daemon?
If this isn't the Living World or the Beyond, why do I feel the faint presence of wandering souls?
I warned you! We should never have come to this crazy place!
A cold wind blows beyond this door. Is this fear I feel? It can't be...
Amazing! Simply amazing! Bravo! The leaden winds of despair that scream here delight me!
If this place was under the palace all along, why was it kept a secret?
I couldn't tell before, but now I sense it clearly: the lingering scent of hoarded hope.
I knew you were possessed all along. The time draws near.
Humans always strive to find hope, even when all hope seems lost.
The world, reflected in a shard of hope... The soul has limitless potential.
Ghosts of hope. Beings unable to even feel sadness. This place is a graveyard for the soul.
The Scourge is what my people called our eternal foe. After we were gone, it became the horror known as the Oni.
If the Oni is a reflection of humanity, does that mean it is a sin just to be human?
The Oni was born from man... Does humanity exist to destroy itself?
The realm of the Oni... Is that where we've been traveling?
The world was once vast. My home was somewhere among the land that was lost.
The Oni, destroyer of worlds, is beneath the palace. What does it mean?
I know this culture and way of thinking is unknown to me, but for some reason it seems so familiar.
Hope buds even in the darkness of despair. You are a truly unfathomable creature.
A world only you, who have faced so much of life, can see. I wish I could go there with you.
The wailing we've been hearing... It was an omen from the Beyond that the Oni was awakening.
So what if the future is fated to end in apocalypse? All the more reason we have to fight.
You who have strayed from the cycle of reincarnation... Rest in peace.
What does destiny want from you? Why must you face these trials alone?
I believe the world can exist without the Oni. It's just that no one's ever managed to kill it before.
A world without the Oni... That's a world I want to live in.
If the Oni will exist as long as humanity does, then humanity's only hope is to change.
We must prove that humanity can change. To do that, we have to kill the Oni.
Something about all this is off. It seems to me that the Oni is merely the will of another.
Shouldn't you hurry up? Isn't there something you need to do?
You've figured out who knows the truth about this realm, right?
The truth about the kingdom has to be revealed. Right?
I'll stay by your side for as long as you wish. I will be the blade with which you carve your path.
I don't know who I was or what I was like in my past life. I don't care, either; I like being with you now.
Kagachi, Seeker of Truth. Your conviction, your memory—it will live on inside of me.
Both you and I have stood against the Scourge. Our fates are still intertwined.
You sought the truth despite your mortality. Only you were capable of this. I applaud you.
Kagachi, you've always protected people. Let me help you.
Kagachi, you who questions humanity. Do not stop. Walk the path you believe is right.
The only thing I can do for you right now is stay by your side, and I am prepared to do just that.
Nobody can decide what's truly right or wrong. The only thing you can do is choose what to believe in.
You were the one who gave us hopes and dreams. We have faith in you.
